# ovirt_vms (Data Source)

Search oVirt VMs by name.

<!-- schema generated by tfplugindocs -->
## Schema

### Required

- `name` (String) Name of the VM to look for.

### Optional

- `fail_on_empty` (Boolean) Fail if no VMs with the given name were found.

### Read-Only

- `id` (String) The ID of this data source (set to the VM name).
- `vms` (Set of Object) Matching VMs returned from oVirt. (see [below for nested schema](#nestedatt--vms))

<a id="nestedatt--vms"></a>
### Nested Schema for `vms`

Read-Only:

- `id` (String) oVirt identifier for the VM.
- `description` (String) User-provided description for the VM.
- `status` (String) Current status of the VM (e.g., `up`, `down`, `paused`).

---

## Example Usage

```hcl
data "ovirt_vms" "this" {
  name          = "instance01-dev"
  fail_on_empty = true
}

output "this" {
  value = data.ovirt_vms.this
}

output "that" {
  value = tolist(data.ovirt_vms.this.vms)[0].id
}
```

## Example Output
```hcl
{
  "fail_on_empty" = true
  "id"             = "instance01-dev"
  "name"           = "instance01-dev"
  "vms" = toset([
    {
      "id"          = "0b7c5201-ac34-42dc-b263-10df7d25647f"
      "description" = "Development instance for testing"
      "status"      = "up"
    },
  ])
}

```
